documents.document: @RicoCraig @lostcont sounds like Brian's local in Donegal would be perfect for the launch
@RicoCraig @lostcont and possibly also slightly disturbing...
@RicoCraig the antithetical promotional poet :-) Me and @lostcont will be your backing singers/dancers
@RicoCraig give me a shout when the preorder opens, I don't think it's active yet?
Love the title & look Know from working with him what a talent @RicoCraig is. Excellent gateway to Aussie lit also. https://t.co/pYlYczkYWX
@RicoCraig it looks & sounds great Rico, & when I read them I'll hear your voice now too. (also I learnt a new word from in deliquesing)
@RicoCraig let's see then
Happy to have responded to a piece in @spontaneity_art previously that then connected me in turn toâ€¦ https://t.co/uSDhBOgE51
@brianlavelle yes, although in a weird way it also reminded me of Pal or Chum dog food adverts from the 70's/80's!
@artphotofilm glad they're helping, all the best with getting through it x
@brianlavelle isn't there, it was only ploughed yesterday. There was lovely light as well but I couldn't get it.
@artphotofilm your Sussex/father's house photos have been so moving Mandy, the pink, the lines & light really caught me. Thanks for sharing.
@godwinafaith ah thanks, I prefer the ploughed field if I'm honest :-)
Traces/Sway https://t.co/YXRjCuF5vc
@pmcottrell will do, thanks
@pmcottrell interesting stuff. Liked that you went on to ask about how confidence was developed. Shame the full interview isn't available.
@clutch need to see if someone can work for me but if so, yes that's the plan. And to offer you shelter from snow of gimme shelter...
@clutch blow it.
I've loved following the making of this film & really hope it makes it out of the drawer & onto a big screen. https://t.co/NAi6MGoorL
@BobbySeal1 no worries, loved it.
@RussDaum just as well as they appear to be compulsive :-)
@sarah_males you're welcome Sarah, me too
Colour of yesterday: this blue was yours https://t.co/i9TtjDbCuM
@SalMcW @HaloLitMag thanks, Sally!
portrait of the artist as a viable alternative to death by @strongmisgiving is a better mindfuck than reality. My review. Repeat. Read.
@strongmisgiving it is. Any time I drink whisky or stand in the rain or say I like abstract expressionism or die I'm going to quote from it
@strongmisgiving just read your book. It was exactly the mindfuck I expected it to be. That is, I liked it very much. That'll be gravity.
@_cynar I do too. Unfortunately. Kind of hoped for a bigger what can you do list at end.
@mmca256 your piece in @HaloLitMag Melanie, is both beautifully melancholic & affirming, not an easy combination!
@_cynar I think this is an interesting read re perspective https://t.co/RCHHAliQrV
@Pandrea100 what course?
@Pandrea100 I've just looked it up. Reckon you'll find lots of opportunities to use it
@Pandrea100 I quite like that. And the random nature of your discoveries.

@betamother & isn't it great that Edinburgh is finally finding it's political feet on the streets (no disrespect there btw)

@rootjournal I'll give it my best shot. Really interesting journal premise.
@sarahms65 @plasllanina all so close together as well, wish I understood it more but it's beautiful.
@plasllanina beautiful day- no gloves & everything . Just been out now though & bloody freezing.
@Tangledfox thank you

Scotland Against Trump. Demonstrate, Edinburgh, Feb 11th. https://t.co/BNNgrYay7h
@baby2jag1 haha, I can see it now you've said that. But it wasn't there so you've freaked me out...
@deilsplantin @brianlavelle put your lippy on in honour :-) you'll be fine x
@deilsplantin @brianlavelle that's exciting. Whereabouts? Enjoy it!
@HugoLeMaltais French & Pessoa in one quote, very good start to the weekend. Merci, Hugo.
@Art_Ed_UK Hi Marilyn, how's things?
@ucdspeccoll I'm going to have to check out the collection in person one day
@ucdspeccoll that's very cool. Thanks for tagging me in - beautiful.
I'm coordinating my photos with decorating a golden wedding anniversary cake. Seamless.

@MrTomYoull thanks for confidence, hopefully rewarded...enjoy Dundee.
@MrTomYoull lucky them...I've got everything I need now so plan is to write next week. Lots of interest which is kind of heartening.
@MrTomYoull not looked out window yet! -' lying in bed with sick kid trying not to move & waken them. Where are you off to?

@SimonGuy64 all change indeed. See you later then.
@SimonGuy64 congratulations. Are you moving to Edinburgh then?? We should go for a walk when you do
@SalMcW congratulations Sally, that's great news, well done x
@Oldmanmackie Hopefully it's gone back out to sea bit if I'm lucky enough to get a glimpse I'll send you a picture
@Oldmanmackie that's who I thought would know!
@Oldmanmackie No worries, knew you'd moved but thought you might keep tabs. I know, I keep missing it...
@wifiedotco yes. I think the context/references of different ages can often be overlooked so it was actually v healthy discussion to have
@wifiedotco yes, v strong responses from women of 60 + who felt they'd fought hard to rid themselves of 'wifey' status (& image)
@Oldmanmackie morning Alan, do you know by any chance if humpback whale is still in Kinghorn bay? I'm debating a quick nip up before work
@wifiedotco when we set up a Fife branch of Women for Indy called Fifey Wifeys, we had huge reaction & discussion,, esp across age groups
Massive thanks to @BigIssueScots for passing resources relating to Frank Tinney, & to all of you who have shared memories/info for my piece.
@plasllanina I still feel sad about Trish. Plus there's that weird tragic symmetry in my head with Mary from Stereolab.
@Oniropolis with a bit of winter sun, Loscil has been hard to beat today. Hope you feel better soon.
@ianparkinsonz why not?
Pry/prise https://t.co/frlXhKccuR
@Lainey__D no worries, thanks for that
@Lainey__D thanks for that. Do you remember when you became aware he wasn't around anymore/heard he'd died?
@BorthwickDave garlands of thanks Davey B
@plasllanina considers bloody harpoon...
@Archieislander this painting was done shortly after his trademark long red dreadlocked hair had been cut off.
Just been speaking to marine medics who are trying to locate a 20m whale that's been seen in bay. I must walk around with eyes shut.
@JenAnneHarvey I've done that :-) I'm specifically asking here...
@Poca_Hontas_ ah thanks very much. We'll see, whole new process for me.
@Poca_Hontas_ well if I do it well enough, hopefully you'll be able to come see it :-)
@Poca_Hontas_ yes, I have background on him but I'm interested in gathering range of memories of him to use in some way
@Archieislander Frank spent a lot of time on streets nearby, & at Queen St & Central stations. (That portrait is by John Kilmartin btw)
